programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to a first-class auction in Arcadia, but when bids quickly start reaching into the thousands, Mary is left struggling to keep up.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton Jones believes he has found whiskey in a gallon flagon, that was smuggled by Al Capone in the 1920s - but cannot decide whether to sell the alcohol or consume it.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton Jones and Allen Haff head to California, where they acquire a 1940s arcade game, a Winchester shotgun and an antique crossbow.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: New store owner Lesa gets started on running the business, while Ricky and Bubba examine a vintage air compressor and Moe discovers some stunning lithographs.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders face tough competition when they find themselves up against 100 rivals at an auction in Longview.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick challenges a potential new recruit to prove his worth by restoring a scooter.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A collector of rare memorabilia asks for a job and the team work on restoring a sign from a 1940s petrol station.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: RJ and Paul invoke the powers of their ancestors before setting out to kill a crocodile named Bigfoot, while Troy makes a discovery that leaves him in a dangerous position.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Turtleman investigates a mysterious predator, and discovers that armadillo burrows are destroying the foundations of someone's home.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Turtleman tries to track down some turkeys that are nesting inside a corn maze and frightening the children that come to visit.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers deal with the most expensive item they have ever appraised, while Rick assesses a 1948 electric shock therapy machine and an off-road vehicle.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and Chum are offered 50 pieces of plastic Americana, and an inscription on a coaching gun provides a puzzle for the pawnbrokers.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Experts unseal files documenting how people have been hunted by UFOs, some more than once. Investigators consider what these UFOs could possibly want and what their next target could be.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Theorists investigate the history of submersible UFOs, and their potential underwater hangars, in light of claims that suggest there could be as many alien crafts dwelling beneath the sea as their are reported in the sky.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The family decides to hold a father-daughter sales competition after Ashley steals a deal from right under Les's nose.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part one of two. Les challenges Seth to sell all the new items within a week after he learns that his son has spent thousands of dollars at a sports card auction.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike finds a rare retro motor in a West Virginia museum, and takes a fancy to an electronic peacock.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike makes a gamble by buying an elephant's head from a taxidermist, and the guys are tempted to purchase an antique hot dog steamer.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders face tough competition when they find themselves up against 100 rivals at an auction in Longview.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: New store owner Lesa gets started on running the business, while Ricky and Bubba examine a vintage air compressor and Moe discovers some stunning lithographs.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba buy a locker full of valuable sci-fi merchandise, while Victor makes a spectacular profit on his latest purchase.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers go to Dallas, where they attend several auctions in one day while facing a frantic race to keep up with the competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A piano, a tea set and some expensive furniture are among the finds up for grabs when the buyers go to Lewisville, Texas.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders consider the benefits and drawbacks of two very different neighbourhoods, and Lesa displays her ruthless side while dealing with a young buyer.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: One of the buyers accidentally acquires a historically important item, while Victor gets his hands on an intriguing locked treasure chest - with no key.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor sets his sights on a scooter that could be worth 3,000 dollars, and Lesa spots a snake-skin ensemble.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: As Christmas approaches, the staff members look over alleged American revolutionary war currency and a battleaxe.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Staff are offered a steak dinner and a cash prize as an incentive to boost profits, and a 1915 calculator and some 200-year-old buttons are brought in.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey considers buying a flawed 1996 Harley Road King motorcycle, and the team examines knives dating back to the Second World War.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team examines a German bayonet from the Second World War, and Richard takes a gamble with a 1930s slot machine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey looks for a good deal for a 1901 Edison phonograph, and Rick assesses the value of a set of small sculptures cast in solid gold but painted black.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff get the chance to buy a rare 1970s Indian mini-motorcycle.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers deal with the most expensive item they have ever appraised, while Rick assesses a 1948 electric shock therapy machine and an off-road vehicle.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and Chum are offered 50 pieces of plastic Americana, and an inscription on a coaching gun provides a puzzle for the pawnbrokers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A model train, allegedly owned by Johnny Cash rolls into the shop, but it remains to be seen whether it is worth adding to Rick's collection.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A piece of the 1990s rolls into the shop as the guys check out 'The Mirthmobile' from Wayne's World.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: An Oregon man shoots some incredible Bigfoot footage, UFOs gather over Texas and an active poltergeist appears in Wales.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Experts investigate the alleged power of foresight and ask whether prophets really can predict disastrous events.

programme.title: The Curse of Civil War Gold
programme.desc: Kevin Dykstra and Marty Lagina base their search for Civil War gold in at the bottom of Lake Michigan on a deathbed confession from a lighthouse keeper in the 1890s.

programme.title: Pirate Traders
programme.desc: Following a lead from their Belize connection, the team heads out in search of a Go Fast - an expensive boat used to smuggle drugs overseas at high speed.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Comedy series starring real-life married couple Jon Richardson and Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together. Jon is given career advice from his comedy hero, Jack Dee. Meanwhile, Lucy signs Jon up to be the celebrity judge at the World Dock Pudding Competition in Hebden Bridge.

credits.actor: Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Jessica Knappett's sunny outlook on life is severely tested by a former traffic warden, and Rhod Gilbert once again endangers Alex's life.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Pointless co-host Alexander Armstrong takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Roisin Conaty and broadcaster James O'Brien joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Jon Richardson: Ultimate Worrier
programme.desc: Jon's wife and fellow comedian Lucy Beaumont is on hand to answer her stressed spouse's worries about himself - and their marriage. Jonathan Ross also guests.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian has found the magical amulet that can potentially send him home - but it doesn't work. Howell tricks him into getting a book from the oddly menacing Munty Library.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Gendle and Tim are dropped into a downhill bike park and create a human marble run using motorbikes and riders wearing zorbs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May each buy a rear-wheel-drive coupe for Â£1,500 and find themselves entered into a French ice race. Richard discovers a way to fill the waiting time for flights by inventing the sport of airport-vehicle racing, Jeremy gets behind the wheel of the BMW Z4, and actress Sienna Miller is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in Cambridge's storage containers, lock-ups and garages.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly oversees bidders in Milton Keynes, where portable toilets are up for grabs. Scotty, Heavy D, Linda, Nat and John also fight for the biggest gains in a Dutch auction.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In California, the guys deal with a collector who is under pressure to downsize, and later play a hunch that turns up a lot of rare vintage cars.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of police officers through body-worn cameras.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Dan and Anna are behind a driver refusing to stop after they spot him smashing into a parked car. When the driver brakes, the pair swiftly realise that the car is about to ram them.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Keith gets lost on the roads of Derbyshire looking for a wanted man. He spots a dodgy van driver who is on the road without insurance, and is forced to make a crucial decision.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers face a harrowing situation as a family from Venezuela pleads with them to enter America. In Progreso, a suspected drug dealer is caught smuggling pills in his underpants.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May are challenged to create a TV advert for Volkswagen, but soon fall out as James concentrates on detailed information on fuel economy and Jeremy wants something more exciting. Richard Hammond explores an alternative to Germanic sports saloons and tests the Vauxhall VXR8 Bathurst, and former US chat show host Jay Leno is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May test-drive an Aston Martin DBS Convertible, a Ferrari California and a Lamborghini Gallardo Convertible through Romania, searching for the mountain highway built during the reign of the country's former dictator Nicolae Ceausescu - allegedly the best road to drive on in the world. Actor Eric Bana is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill, as it arrives in Paris.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests Dara O Briain, Denise Van Outen, Rhod Gilbert and Vernon Kay, who try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Charles Dance, Stephen Mangan, Isy Suttie and Gok Wan join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy's discussion about whether they should have another child descends into psychological warfare. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy think they have bought the perfect Christmas present for seven-year old Charlie and five-year-old twins Benji and Molly. However, their pride in their parenting is short-lived when the youngsters' grandparents buy exactly the same gift and beat them to the punch by handing it over on Christmas Eve. Lee ventures into the streets on the night before Christmas and faces a desperate race against time to find a suitable replacement. Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in a festive episode of the sitcom.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Jen Brister, Rob Beckett and Lou Sanders are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: IT Crowd star and The Crystal Maze host Richard Ayoade takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedy writer Andy Hamilton one of the guests joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: A look at the planet's most incredible metropolitan railways, and how they help people solve distinctly urban problems. Including a project to upgrade New York's transit system..

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at the sinister history of Edinburgh's vaults and the development of Helsinki's subterranean spaces. Plus, the impact of the building of Naples on the volcanic ground below.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: How Hitler used recreation to promote his ideology, setting up the world's largest beach resort and travel agency and attempting to turn the Olympics into a propaganda tool.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.sub-title: Tudor Parfitt & The Lost Tribes of Israel
programme.desc: The claims of British historian, writer, broadcaster and adventurer Professor Tudor Parfitt, who says he located an African tribe of Jews called the Lemba whose roots can be traced back to the Jews of the Old Testament.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into the staff of Moses, one of the more astonishing miracles depicted in the Bible as Moses turned his staff into a snake.

programme.title: The Diary of Anne Frank: A Tale of Two Sisters
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story of Anne Frank and Eva Schloss, whose lives intertwined during the darkest of period of 20th-century history. Eva, who met Anne in Amsterdam in 1938, survived Auschwitz and here talks about her memories of the young diarist, her survival from the death camps, and how she became the step daughter of Anne's Father, Otto Frank.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: One of the largest Nazi bunkers ever constructed, outside the French town of Watten, a missile facility with storage for 108 missiles, a liquid oxygen factory and two launch pads.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: An investigation into a wreck in the Bristol Channel identified by divers as a First World War hospital ship, the sinking of which constituted a major war crime.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: Divers explore the wreck of First World War battleship HMS Audacious, which was once the pride of the Royal Navy and thought to be 'unsinkable' until a single unexpected blow sealed its fate 14 miles off the coast of Northern Ireland.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: Part one of two. Using the latest diving technology to explore the South-West's deep-sea wrecks.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: Experts look into new areas of technology to locate the SS Armenian, a cargo liner carrying 1,400 mules, which was sunk by a German U-Boat in 1915 but never found.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist ventures into uncharted territory in pursuit of new discoveries. He takes on physical challenges, encounters extraordinary wildlife and meets remarkable people. In the first edition, Steve and a team of climbers and jungle survival experts head into the ancient landscape of South America's Guiana Shield. This vast wilderness of pristine forests and towering table-top mountains is one of the most inaccessible terrains on the planet.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: In the Jebel Akhdar mountain range of Oman, Steve leads an expedition into an unexplored desert canyon. With temperatures soaring, dehydration and heat stroke are a constant threat.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of kayakers head to the Himalayas to visit the last great unexplored river in Bhutan. Legend has it that at some point, the river drops off the face of the planet.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist ventures into uncharted territory in pursuit of new discoveries. He takes on physical challenges, encounters extraordinary wildlife and meets remarkable people. In the first edition, Steve and a team of climbers and jungle survival experts head into the ancient landscape of South America's Guiana Shield. This vast wilderness of pristine forests and towering table-top mountains is one of the most inaccessible terrains on the planet.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: In the Jebel Akhdar mountain range of Oman, Steve leads an expedition into an unexplored desert canyon. With temperatures soaring, dehydration and heat stroke are a constant threat.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of kayakers head to the Himalayas to visit the last great unexplored river in Bhutan. Legend has it that at some point, the river drops off the face of the planet.

programme.title: Big in America: British Hits in the USA
programme.desc: Compilation of British rock 'n' roll acts in performance, featuring songs that crossed over to the US charts. From the Dave Clark Five to Coldplay, the Brits have rocked America and sometimes even done better across the pond than on home soil. A Flock of Seagulls, Supertramp and Bush also feature, alongside darker British global exports like Black Sabbath and the Cure.

programme.title: Duran Duran: There's Something You Should Know
programme.desc: Simon Le Bon, John Taylor, Nick Rhodes and Roger Taylor open up about the highs and lows of the band's career - with archive footage of former guitarist Andy Taylor helping round out the story. The documentary charts their trajectory through seven of their 14 albums, each one uncovering a compelling chapter in the history of five lads from Birmingham who had one simple dream - to become the biggest band in the world. Contributors include Boy George, Nile Rodgers and Mark Ronson.

programme.title: The True Story of the Mary Celeste
programme.desc: On December 4, 1872, the Mary Celeste was found adrift in the Atlantic with its cargo fully intact, yet with no one on board. Experts use CGI and fresh evidence in a bid to solve the mystery of the ship and learn how and why its crew disappeared.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of Lukshmi Villas Palace in India, which was built for the Maharaja of Baroda in 1890 and remains the home of the royal family to this day.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris attempts to cross the length of Cuba, the only island in the Caribbean to boast an extensive railway network, starting in Havana in the west. This proves to be a major challenge given the unreliability of the service and the old trains regularly used, but makes for a fascinating journey to Chris's ultimate goal, the American naval base at Guantanamo Bay. Along the way he soaks up the sights and sounds of Havana, retraces the footsteps of the country's national hero Che Guevara, and visits the ghost town of Camilo Cienfuegos - a relic from Cuba's colonial sugar plantation era.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the police drama in which Boyd and the team investigate the murder of a Home Office adviser. All fingers seem to point to the institution's private secretary, who reluctantly admits to having met with the dead woman on the night she was killed. Finally, Frankie finds forensic evidence that promises to clear up any doubt. Starring Trevor Eve.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina continues to keep the news of her cancer a closely guarded secret, little suspecting Amber has put two and two together after spotting her at the hospital. Gabriel rescues schoolgirl Gemma Bentley from the clutches of her wicked stepmother and is rewarded with a passionate kiss from Sheelagh, while Steve confronts Scott about the investigation into his wife's murder - and is given an ominous warning.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The crew are called in to deal with a huge explosion in a nightclub. Meanwhile, the private eye tells Bayleaf that he has found his daughter Melanie.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: The sleuthing monk investigates the murder of a pregnant woman and the priest who rejected her confession. At first it looks as though suicide is a major factor in the case, but Cadfael is not convinced and, of course, he is proved right once the clues start falling into place. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A collector from Australia visits Britain to search for the one item he's coveted all his life - the legendary Benin Bronze. Unfortunately, the DTI won't allow an export licence, so he devises another way of getting hold of it. Drama, starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Eric manages to land Lovejoy in hospital with a broken leg, so the incapacitated dealer tasks Lady Jane and Tinker with selling a terracotta Chinese pig to a Chinese banker on his behalf. However, it gets broken and inside they find a valuable medieval Chinese bank note. Ian McShane directs and stars.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Learning Napoleon has returned from exile, Sharpe leaves Lucille to look after their farm and returns to service on the Prince of Orange's staff. It isn't long before he's reunited with the remaining Chosen Men for one of the most momentous military engagements of all time - the Battle of Waterloo. Sean Bean, Daragh O'Malley, Hugh Fraser and Cecile Paoli star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Thornley Manor turns out to be a listed building and the lads are forced to down tools while negotiations take place at a higher level. During the unexpected interlude, they set about making themselves unpopular with local pub landlord Arthur Pringle. Tim Healy and Jimmy Nail star, with Bryan Pringle.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Wayne's sexual antics with Pringle's daughter result in the lads being evicted from the Barley Mow, leaving them with no alternative but to camp out in Thornley Manor. However, its owner Ally Fraser remains unaware he is providing them with free board and lodging. Tim Healy and Gary Holton star.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Peregrine bites off more than she expected while investigating a murder at an international cookery school, exposing a maze of corruption that leads back to the Melbourne police.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates an apparent suicide, believing the death of a recently returned RAF pilot to be murder. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest is determined to find out why the body of a young man was taken from his graveyard. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The coffin of local poet Declan O'Grady falls from the hearse revealing that the corpse inside is not his but a young woman identifiable only by a notable scarlet tattoo. Funeral director Warren Bugle directs Mike, Kristin and Breen to Wadsworth Manor where a mysterious role-playing game was conducted the night before Declan's death..

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Murdoch suspects murder at what first appears to be the double suicide of a wealthy high-society couple, who are found floating in their pool.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Sam faces a race against time as he attempts to forget his troubles and focus on an investigation into the kidnapping of a man's wife and daughter. As he picks through the details of the crime, he begins to consider who may be motivated to hold the pair hostage - only for Annie to leave herself exposed when she discovers the kidnapper's true identity. Fantasy drama, starring John Simm and Philip Glenister.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Gene investigates the shooting of a Ugandan Asian man and jumps to the conclusion that the attack is drug-related when he finds a suspicious bag of powder on the victim. When the substance turns out to be heroin, the policeman becomes determined to keep it off the streets of Manchester - and decides to do whatever it takes to get his way. Fantasy drama, starring Philip Glenister and John Simm.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A brother and sister stand accused of murdering their father and stepmother, and pleading for them proves to be the most complex assignment of Kavanagh's entire career. The task is made doubly difficult by the man's insistence on defending himself and a tragedy within his own family - and Julia's decision to leave chambers does not help either. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Anna Chancellor and Art Malik.

programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, with Anna Jones.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: McDonald & Dodds
programme.sub-title: The Fall of the House of Crockett
programme.desc: Mystery drama set in Bath, where the wildly ambitious DCI McDonald finds herself paired with the shy, modest DS Dodds, who has languished on the shelf for most of his working life. However, it soon turns out the unassuming sergeant has a hidden talent for puzzle solving. Their first case sees the pair looking into the shooting of a homeless man in the deserted mansion of local industrialist Max Crockett. The Crockett appear to be a close-knit group but it soon becomes clear they have secrets to hide. Jason Watkins and Tala Gouveia star as the detectives, with a guest appearance from Robert Lindsay.

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: Sarah Mack and Angus Simpson find out about one of the worst storms to hit Scotland, celebrate the QE2, and learn about Nan Shepherd, who appears on the Scottish Â£5 note, and Celtic's barefoot Indian footballer Mohammed Salim.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Alex falls asleep while guarding his father's castle, allowing Sykronior to turn Kingsland into his new holiday home.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.sub-title: The Truth Is Far Out There
programme.desc: The team members think that they are facing a new Sykronian weapon when a vortex appears in the sky over Enchanted Island.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Fast flowing waters await Danny in today's dare as he takes on a white-water rafting course including the UK's steepest man-made drop..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: When Magoo treats Mr Cat to a parachute jump, the two friends land on the top of the AeroFizz. Mr Magoo mistakes it for a desert island!.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo mistakes Weasel (in an animal costume) for a groundhog being hunted, and confiscates the hunter's gun..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz is at the pool, he wants to start sub-marine hairdressing! But Magoo, thinks he is fishing in a lake, and starts trying to catch Weasel..

programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean is cajoled by Irma and spurred by jealousy of the fund-raising star Declan into raising money for a donkey sanctuary..

programme.sub-title: Innervasion Part 4: Mind Over Alien Matter

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by guests Ade Adepitan, Raymond Blanc, Tom Kerridge and Dr Hazel Wallace.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up their version of classic Chinese dish crispy duck pancakes, and follow it up with spicy cauli wings with ranch sauce, a herby stew, and their pain au chococake. Their guest is chef Luke Robinson, who prepares miso glazed aubergine.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of today's meetings, featuring the Imperial Cup and three other races from Sandown Park, plus three races from Wolverhampton. With analysis from Mick Fitzgerald and Luke Harvey, with reports by Oli Bell, Matt Chapman and Natalie Green, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Wales (Kick-off 4.45pm). All the action from both teams' penultimate match of the championship, held at Twickenham. England kept their title hopes alive with a 24-12 victory over Ireland last time out, while last year's Grand Slam-winners Wales look set to relinquish their crown after suffering back-to-back defeats against the Irish and France. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Clive Woodward, Jonny Wilkinson, Gareth Thomas and Mike Phillips, pitchside reports by Martin Bayfield, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Shane Williams and Lawrence Dallaglio.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: Jax Jones and Ella Henderson perform live at the start of this week's entertainment extravaganza, while the hosts face a dance battle with Britain's Got Talent: The Champions winners Twist & Pulse in the End of the Show Show. Plus, Stephen Mulhern returns for Ant vs Dec Goes Global, one lucky audience member plays to Win the Ads and the Men in Brown continue on their mission to track down which mystery celebrity has The Squits. More deserving audience members and viewers at home also win a Place on the Plane.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the third and final episode of the Battle rounds. Coaches Will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor all return to their infamous red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions go head to head and fight for their place on their coach's team. The singers that impress their coach the most remain in the competition, but those that aren't so lucky can still be stolen by another coach.

programme.title: Pitch Perfect (2012)
programme.desc: A new student finds herself a social outcast during her first year of college, but soon acquires a new circle of friends in a band of misfits with a shared talent for singing. She joins their a cappella group and leads them to compete in the campus music competitions. Comedy, starring Anna Kendrick, Rebel Wilson and Elizabeth Banks.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How giant floating power stations and the world's smallest aircraft are created.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer combines his love of vintage Escorts and rallying by making a Ford rally car, and it is left to Edd China to try to make a profit on such an expensive build.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Husband and wife Nick and Jo risk one last supply to a remote settlement as the wet season looms. Meanwhile, Craig and his son deliver hay to drought-hit stations.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Jr gets into trouble when he jumps the gun on fabrication and his father's manners are put under the spotlight.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Rich and Kathy need to save their 1951 Buick Super, and hope FantomWorks can help. Jim's classic 1961 Corvette has a strange ailment - and Dan must solve the mystery.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe travels to Arizona and tries his hand at moving a giant cactus. He then he heads to Idaho to work with millions of maggots.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How nail clippers, jade putters, ice cider and water skis are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A look at how stagecoaches, road reflectors and custom motorcycle tanks are made and how manufacturing processes have developed over the years.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: King Crab season draws to a close as Casey forces Josh to fish at full throttle on the Cornelia Marie and Jake takes another turn at the wheel on the Northwestern.

programme.title: Alaska Mega Machines
programme.desc: A rugged ship built to withstand tsunami-size waves travels on a highway unlike any other in North America. Plus, a fleet of machines combats a massive flood.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China begins revamping an old Range Rover bought by Mike Brewer, but problems soon arise when the vehicle's CO2 emissions are tested.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China adds the finishing touches to the newly transformed Range Rover, and Mike Brewer takes the vehicle out for a test drive before putting it up for sale.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer finds a Land Rover Discovery for Â£1,500 and hands it over to mechanic Edd China for restoration work.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mechanic Edd China finishes working on the Land Rover Discovery and, after a successful road test, Mike Brewer has a buyer lined up.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a V8-powered Land Rover Defender for less than Â£5,000, that modifications expert Edd China can turn into a modern urban vehicle.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a bargain Range Rover P38 and mechanic Edd China sets about mending it. They then take the car to Exmoor for a final test drive before looking for a buyer.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: After a nerve-racking test-drive, Mike Brewer buys a 1981 Series III Land Rover without an MOT for Edd China to restore.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys an old Range Rover Mk3 for a bargain price, hoping Edd China can renovate it and have it resprayed white in order to pass it on for double the amount he paid.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: In the Southern Andes, the team uncovers the town of Bariloche and the Inalco House, where Hitler could have stayed. Using network and financial analysis the team descends on Hotel Eden, a compound owned by two known and documented Nazi supporters, where an eyewitness claims to have seen Hitler, months after his supposed death.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: The team tracks down a unique marker, taking them to a maze-like location riddled with caves. The determination pays off as they start unearthing priceless artefacts.

programme.title: Expedition Mungo
programme.sub-title: Deadly Dragon of Borneo: Expedition Mungo
programme.desc: The story of a serpent that prowls Borneo's waterways, hunting children as they swim. Mungo tries to separate fact from fiction.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: New mining team The Tunnel Rats blasts its way to a fortune and solo prospector Col Duff gets stranded deep in the Queensland outback. Rookie Sam runs out of air underground.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer claims ownership of a 1973 Ford Mustang Mach 1, and mechanic Ant Anstead tries to restore its lost power by tuning up and enhancing the engine.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Three British farmers try to run three very different family farms across the UK, experiencing the challenges and rewards that come with making a living off the land.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: With his new shop opening to the public, Drew Pritchard needs more stock. He spots a '60s Danish sofa in Malvern, Worcestershire, and a pair of tapestries in Welshpool, Powys.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: Colin Murray introduces a round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Leeds United v Hudderfield Town and Swansea City v West Browmich Albion.

programme.title: Stars in Their Cars
programme.desc: England Cricket star Phil Tufnell gets behind the wheel of a classic boy racer car. He drives a heavyweight saloon and a surprising amount of speed..

programme.title: Stars in Their Cars
programme.desc: Political heavyweight John Prescott navigates Liverpool in his first set of wheels and revisits the scene of an infamous punch up in his former government motor..

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: A classic love triangle that lasted 16 years led to a shocking murder by Lakhvir Singh in 2009. Her method of killing gave her the nickname 'The Curry Killer'.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The use of DNA evidence to find a missing trucker. Plus, how two sudden deaths were not as coincidental as they appeared.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: The case of 14-year-old Reena Virk, who was burnt, beaten and eventually drowned by her peers in Victoria, Canada.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of 14-year-old April Millsap, whose body was recovered from a bike trail near the village of Armada, Michigan in July 2014. Millsap's dog, Penny, alerted a pair of joggers to the girl's remains. James VanCallis was later convicted of attempted sexually assault and murder.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A series of robberies in Detroit caused panic in 1994, but when one homeowner got the chance to fire a shot at the intruders, detectives gained a vital clue to their identities.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigators head to out to a property they've visited before in the desert, where 30 dogs are living in what is essentially a rubbish tip. Can they remove them all safely?.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A West Highland Terrier called Chester dislikes skateboarders. Concerned that he will bite someone, his owners take him to see Chris to see if he can help tame him.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Carmel desperately needs a sale to hit her monthly goal, while Keasha works with bride-to-be Heidi who recently donated a kidney to her fiance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A family bickers and does not listen to what the bride wants. Plus, a mother demands her daughter's custom gown be redesigned.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A demanding dad dominates his daughter's shopping trip, while another father of the bride expects answers when a custom fitting goes wrong.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to help a West Highland terrier overcome his phobia of skateboards and visits the Australian Reptile Park to take swabs from an alligator and a python.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Veterinary surgeon Chris Brown hopes to find a new home for an orphaned Shih Tzu with a chronic ear problem.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Unable to care for herself, Katrina's weight has placed a burden on her parents. Is it too late for Katrina to repair the damage to her body?.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Unable to care for herself, Katrina's weight has placed a burden on her parents. Is it too late for Katrina to repair the damage to her body?.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Amber, who is 23 and weighs more than 600lb, relies on her family for even the simplest of tasks, so she travels more than 2,000 miles for weight-loss surgery.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Susan is committed to drastic weight loss, but when a medical disorder affects her mobility, her plight becomes a matter of life and death.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 35-year-old mother Deanne Hastings, who failed to return home after leaving a note indicating she was running to the local store. As detectives found more information, troubling theories emerged.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Syndal marries into New York Yankee royalty and her friends come with notepads to help rate each dress. Plus, bride-to-be Danielle returns for her first fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kate heads to the salon with an entourage that includes her father, and Nancy takes advice from her fashionista dad, as both brides try to find the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Liza returns to the salon to top her dress with two skirts she has designed. Leanne purchases a cheap gown without conviction, and Ivania arrives with her opinionated fiance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former waitress Janine, who is used to striking clothes, has a princess gown in mind. Meanwhile, pregnant bride Christina is worried about her growing body.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Michelle expresses her interest in dresses by the salon's exclusive designer, Pnina Tornai. Meanwhile, a Greek woman looks for a bargain, and Audrey and Randy try to please Lillian.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Niki Ann arrives at the shop with a $5,000 budget, Dawn's mother turns up with something to help make shopping easier and Kristyn plans to wow her guests with her dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Jesyca wants a flattering dress, Duvae is looking for something sophisticated and Sara returns for her fitting, following her surprise proposal at Kleinfeld's.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Justyna searches for a dress with just hours until her wedding, Shauna seems like she would rather be somewhere else and Sherry brings along her fiance.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo receives some surprising results from her brain scan test with Dr Amen. Later, at a group reading, Theresa proves the presence of a loved one.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa is asked to officiate a wedding for two people who met at one of her group readings, and surprises a woman on Wall Street.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Geoffrey has already lost his home due to his hoarding habit, and now has just 30 days to clear the clutter or lose everything.

programme.title: People Magazine Investigates
programme.desc: In 2002, a 12-year-old girl from Oregon City went missing on her way to school. The police investigation offered little in the way of leads, and then a second girl disappeared.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The case of Californian teacher Laci Peterson, who disappeared in December 2002 while eight months pregnant with her first child. Her husband Scott claimed he last saw her before he went fishing - but his secret mistress exposed his lies. Experts examine his behaviour.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: How, on a freezing Minnesota night, a ruthless shooting left a young police officer fighting for his life by the road. A tense manhunt for the three suspects ensued.
